response.answer_text: It depends, usually at the state of "debut'' or the start of a band/group/solo artist it's mainly the company's employer who writes the songs to the group. However later on, the group or some of the group members can write their own songs and lyrics and seek the approval of the company to record it. Bigger groups and solo artists write their own songs and have the right to record them by their own if the company's given them the approval in the contract :)

Some of K-Pop songs are written by singer. But most of songs are written by professional composer and lyricist. YG and SM have good professional composers and lyricists.  Also sometime producer writes K-Pop songs also. JYP is one of the case. JYP is a producer and K-pop songs maker.
